softwareGame

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • softwareGame.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    graphicInterface.InterfaceGame

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements graphicInterface.InterfaceGame
    Run the game between a player and the computer.
    Version:
    2.0

        public void setIndState(int val)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        tools.InvariantBrokenException
        This method is called when an event is produced in the graphical interface.
        Parameters:
        val - The state of the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if val is out of bounds.
        tools.InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.String name)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       tools.InvariantBrokenException
        Create a stock, a board, two players (player and computer), initialize the graphical interface : hand, button and send it the first message.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null.
        tools.InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • getEnd

        public int getEnd(int side)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Retrieve a end value of the table.
        Parameters:
        side - The side to be considered : 1 or 2 (1: left, 2: right)
        Returns:
        The extremity value of the domino on the considered side the table. -1 if the table is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if side is not either 1 nor 2.

      • treatDoubleAnswer

        public void treatDoubleAnswer(DominoInt d)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Take the selected domino, verify if can be put on the table. If it is ok, call treatAnswer method otherwise send a message.
        Parameters:
        d - The selected domino.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.

      • treatAnswer

        public void treatAnswer(DominoInt d)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        tools.InvariantBrokenException
        When a player plays, we remove d from the hand of the player and from the graphical hand. Then put d on the board and on the graphic table. Check if the player wins. Otherwise, call computerDecide.
        Parameters:
        d - The domino selected by the player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.
        tools.InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • playerDraw

        public void playerDraw()
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       tools.InvariantBrokenException
        The player draw. If the stock is empty, the computer plays (state 9) otherwise the drawn domino is added to the hand and the graphic hand and, then, the computer plays (state 8).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not on the values [7,8].
        tools.InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • computerPlay

        public void computerPlay()
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         tools.InvariantBrokenException
        The computer plays in relationship with the state of the game. If state = n (with n =1,2,3,4,5,6) we look for a double n in the computer's hand. If yes, the computer plays else the player is asked to play the double domino (n-1). If n=0 we look for a double 0 in the computer's hand. If yes, the computer plays, otherwise the player is asked to play any other domino. If n=9, the pc can play a domino piece. If n=10, the pc can not play. The pc draws from the stock. If n=11 the pc is blocked. If n=12 the pc can play but the stock is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not on the values [0..6,9-12].
        tools.InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • treatJumpAnswer

        public void treatJumpAnswer()
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        To verify that the player does not cheat when clicking on the Jump button. A player can Jump only when he/she does not possess the double searched, Or when he/she does not possess a piece that matches any of the ends of the table and the stock is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not on the values [0..6,7,8,13].

      • computerDecide

        public void computerDecide()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           tools.InvariantBrokenException
        Prepare the game for the PC. Verify if it is possible for the PC to put a domino piece on the table and change the indState properly. Send the appropriate message to the player and ask to click on the Play PC button to validate the action.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not on the values [0..6,7,8,10,13].
        tools.InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • setButtons

        public void setButtons(int state)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Enable the Jump, Draw, Play PC and Hand buttons according to the state. States 0-6, 8, 13 allow only to jump. 7 allows only to draw. 10 allows only to computer play. -1 blocks all the buttons.
        Parameters:
        state - value to indicate block or enable the appropriate buttons.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not on the values [-1..13].

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
